tutorial.title: Using CSS Grid and Flexbox
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to combine CSS Grid and Flexbox in the same webpage

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent: Let's see how to combine the unique strengths of CSS Grid and Flexbox when it comes to creating a webpage.

lessons.title: CSS Grid
lessons.interactiveContent:
CSS Grid is great for combining rows and columns, which makes it ideal for creating an overall layout.

Make sure to pick display, followed by grid.

lessons.title: CSS Grid Drawbacks
lessons.interactiveContent:
However, using just CSS Grid limits how we can display items.

How can we display the navigation links on the right side of the div, without moving the articles, using only CSS grid properties?

We can't do it with just CSS GridWith justify-content: end

We can't do it with just CSS Grid.

lessons.title: Different Approach
lessons.interactiveContent:
If in the previous example we use justify-content: end to move the navigation links to the right we end up moving all of the grid items.

We'll need to try a different approach.

Make sure to pick justify followed by - and then content, end.

lessons.title: Combining CSS Grid and Flexbox
lessons.interactiveContent:
One way to address this is to turn grid items into flex containers. Let's set up the classes to do that.

Add a header class to the first grid item. We'll use this to add Flexbox to the item.

Make sure to pick header.

lessons.title: Adding Flexbox
lessons.interactiveContent:
Now we can add Flexbox inside a grid item.

Make sure to pick header, followed by display, and finally flex.

lessons.title: Flexbox - content
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can then use Flexbox to align grid items exactly the way we want.

Make sure to pick justify-content, followed by flex-end.

lessons.title: Flexbox Across Two Columns
lessons.interactiveContent:
Because the element of class header is now both a Grid item and a Flexbox container, we can use properties that belong to both layouts.

Split up the grid into two columns and make the element of class header span across both columns.

Make sure to pick 1fr 1fr, followed by grid-column: span 2;.

lessons.title: Question: CSS Grid
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which layout is ideal for creating a webpage with both row and column sections?

Grid layoutFlex layout

Grid layout.

lessons.title: Question: Flexbox
lessons.interactiveContent:
What layout is ideal for aligning the contents of headers?

Flexbox layoutGrid layout

Flexbox layout.

lessons.title: Question: Combining CSS Grid and Flexbox
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we put a Flexbox container inside a Grid container?

The Flexbox container becomes a Grid itemThe Flexbox container becomes a Grid container

The Flexbox container becomes a Grid item.

lessons.title: Question: CSS Grid - structure
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which display property value is ideal for defining the overall structure of a webpage?

gridflex

Make sure to pick grid.

lessons.title: Question: Flexbox - content
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which is ideal for aligning items on a webpage?

FlexboxGrid

Make sure to pick Flexbox.

lessons.title: Example: CSS Grid
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a two-dimensional layout by choosing the right property and value.

Make sure to pick display, followed by grid.

lessons.title: Example: CSS Grid - structure
lessons.interactiveContent:
To define the structure of the webpage, code the property and set the value so that there are three rows and two columns.

Make sure to pick repeat(3, 1fr), followed by 1fr 1fr.

lessons.title: Example: Flexbox
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the footer item span across two columns.

Make sure to pick grid-column followed by : and then span, 2, ;.

lessons.title: Example: Flexbox II
lessons.interactiveContent:
Turn the footer section into a one-dimensional layout.

Make sure to pick display, followed by flex.

lessons.title: Example: Flexbox - content
lessons.interactiveContent:
Center the footer content along the main axis.

Make sure to pick justify-content, followed by center.
